text: [Music]
hi and welcome to business builders
today we are joined by alex medcarf ceo
and co-founder of naoka a live streaming
platform alex welcome nyoka's mission is
to bring people together for important
moments tell us more about how you do
this well thank you for having me
firstly we formed in 2018
we previously worked in a funeral home
so when we george and i we started a
live streaming business we felt we
wanted to deliver live streaming and
online recordings to families it was
being delivered at an unreasonable price
point and we wanted to make it cost
effective so it could be part of every
service that's wonderful and
congratulations on building that great
service obviously the demand for this
service must really have changed in the
last two years can you tell us a bit
about that journey we went from
streaming around 400 funerals
a month and we're now well over 2 000.
the actual viewing audiences have gone
from 15 people watching each funeral up
to over a hundred what we found is that
it's blown out the budget and then
obviously the infrastructure and
maintenance we needed to deliver to
support that you're absolutely right we
saw so many media companies struggling
to scale their services to meet the
growing demand in the last two years and
what they were telling us is that
they're often overrun by costs their
quality suffers so really interested to
hear from you on what changes you've had
to make from a technology standpoint to
maintain or even possibly improve your
customer experience the real decision we
had to make was with the 550
view audience spike was whether we were
going to just increase our costs and
push that out or whether we were going
to rebuild re-analyze and start again
and keep the same price point before
when we were using the third party
providers if one of them made changes to
their platform it would then impact
everything else and we were having to
look at twitter updates to find when
downtime was going to happen and certain
servers were switched off so we used to
spend about 30 of our developer hours
maintaining our existing programs moving
on to the aws platform we really found
that the whole integrated service
provided us a great platform to reduce
costs to reduce maintenance time and to
carry on basically delivering our
streaming at the price point that we
wanted and we felt was acceptable did
that set you up to expand your streaming
services into other occasions as well
the best thing about the the aws
experience is we've been given sort of
really good points of contact with the
account manager and the solutions
architect so we now use an integrated
approach to s3 to route 53 cloud front
and media live the aws team have also
helped us reduce costs by providing that
outcome for us and showing us how to do
it we're looking at branching out into
education some government council
streaming most topical at the moment is
the aviation side where we're looking at
streaming engine failures back to sort
of a service desk we currently go
through trialling of a platform which is
going to allow them to get their pilots
to stream cracks in engines etc back to
a help desk of engineers hopefully give
them a much more flexible support
service to help them get back in the sky
as quickly as possible very exciting and
it's very cool and obviously i want to
know how we at aws can play a role in
whatever is next for you at naoka tell
us a bit more about how we can help you
the key things and this has been like
the standout tenant of the support we've
received from aws straight away has been
they care about our business and
supporting us with partners such as dnx
for example who are able to come in and
do a solutions sort of architecture
review and then analyze where our
business may be able to sort of step up
its quality level and reliability and we
can maybe even reduce costs on the
platform itself
so what we've been able to do is keep
our developer hours low by using
outsourced professionals partly
facilitated by the aws team
and allow our staff to sort of put the
effort into the customer i'm so happy
that aws and our partners have been able
to help you on that journey and thanks
to you for joining us thank you to
everyone out there for joining us today
and stay tuned for our next episode of
business builders
[Music]
